ast.name: Wabbit Wars
ast.comment: Rabbit, run away from the turtles!  Pass through gates to destroy turtles and score points. Pick up broken turtle shells to get point multipliers. Eat a carrot to restore health. What a wascally wipoff!

body.text: in the beginning, there is only the rabbit
no other actors yet
for debug purposes, we can turn off artwork, in which case we just use basic sprites

thenBody.text: this picture is used for when we run into a turtle
the carrot appears occasionally, if we get it, health increases

body.text: carrot is hidden until needed later

decls.name: gates
decls.comment: gates are the only way for a rabbit to get rid of turtles

body.text: a flock of p turtles appears in one of four corners at random
add the flock

a gate has a bar connecting two bombs; if the rabbit passes across the bar without touching a bomb, they explode, killing turtles; if rabbit hits a bomb, the rabbit's health decreases and the gate disappears
link the bar to its bombs and bombs to their bar
the coordinates of the bombs are a function of the bar

decls.name: shells
decls.comment: when it dies, each turtle turns into two small diamonds

body.text: each gate bomb explodes by expanding, killing turtles
the rabbit is represented by an invisible circle for the purposes of collision detection; the artwork (picture) of the rabbit is then associated with the circle sprite
another invisible sprite which is where the rabbit is moving to, based on last touch point
create boundary that keeps sprites on game board
create sprites for banner and debug
display initial board
need to figure out where the ends of the gates are now, as the game engine has moved the gate's bar
straightforward trigonometry
some sprites need their state updated after physics is applied to parents
the physics engine rotates the bar of each gate; to keep the bombs in sync, we need to compute their new positions after bars have been updated
when a turtle is killed, it leaves behind two shell fragments that persist for a while; opacity is used to control shell life

decls.name: rabbit move to
decls.comment: target that rabbit is moving towards (based on last touch)

body.text: rabbit only moves if we are touching the board

thenBody.text: invisible sprite that rabbit is moving towards

body.text: like the rabbit, a turtle is represented by an invisible sprite (a diamond); the artwork sprite merely follows this sprite around (see game postprocess)
turtle opacity is low, indicating is not yet active
associate the turtle artwork with the sprite
spawn turtles and a gate every N seconds, where N is determined by the action "game get next spawn"

thenBody.text: make sure we don't get too many sprites!
after some generations, spawn a carrot at random

body.text: the logic for making the game harder over time; generations counts the number of turtle pods spawned
tell the physics engine to keep sprites on the board
display boundary in red

decls.name: metrics
decls.comment: various metrics kept per game instance

body.text: check for new high score
the abstract state of a carrot is defined by whether it is visible, its opacity and its angular speed
state transitions for the carrot

thenBody.text: the carrot is on the board and has not been caught yet
carrot caught, set opacity lower to signify this

elseBody.text: goodbye to this carrot, it has not been caught

thenBody.text: the carrot has been caught and is on its way to health sprite

elseBody.text: the carrot has made its way to health sprite

body.text: da title
Da wabbit
Da turtles
da carrot
how to get started
To turn on/off art
To turn on/off sound
To get instructions
The instructions

decls.name: rabbit takes a hit from turtle

body.text: the gate appears at a random place, with random angle and velocity
expand the bombs associated with the gate for a while

thenBody.text: expand the bombs radii and diminish their opacity
get rid of turtles that the bombs overlap with

elseBody.text: get rid of the gate and bombs

body.text: Fast approximate flocking using random moves

thenBody.text: move turtle away from turtle2
but also keep moving towards rabbit
combine the two speeds

body.text: we update everything else at a third the rate of the rabbit
check for collision with bombs before bars

decls.name: bombs
decls.comment: there is a bomb on each end of a gate

body.text: get the gate that this bomb belongs to

thenBody.text: turn gate all red to signify collision of rabbit and bomb

body.text: slightly change the rotation and speed of the gate
make sure the speeds aren't ridiculous by bounding them above and below

thenBody.text: turtle in process of dying
turtle not yet active

body.text: sprite for showing frames per second (only in debug mode)
gate state transitions

thenBody.text: gate growing
rabbit has collided with a gate's bomb, so decrease opacity for a bit
gate/bomb explosion continues
at random, change some things about the gate

body.text: abstract state of shell determined by its color and opacity

thenBody.text: rabbit captured this shell
opacity determines life of shell

decls.name: banner
decls.comment: encapsulates score, high score, multiplier, health and frame rate

body.text: the banner object contains all the informational sprites

thenBody.text: update abstract state of all sprites
physics engine updates sprite positions
some sprite state is a function of other sprites
